a promise to tell something to someone confidently or firmly, or a promise to cause someone to feel certain by removing doubt: [ C ] He gave me his assurance that he would give us an answer by the end of the week.
Assurance is also a feeling of confidence in your abilities: [ U ] She answered all the questions put to her with assurance and poise.
Add to word list
Add to word list
INSURANCE a type of insurance, especially life insurance, that will pay an amount of money at the end of an agreed period or when someone dies, rather than only if something unexpected happens: an assurance policy
a promise that something is or behaves as expected: People often look to brands as an assurance of quality. Although the Fund will strive to achieve its goal, there is no assurance that it will. See also
